Annuity.origin: [Medieval Latin annuitas , from Latin annuus yearly]

1.definition: an amount payable at regular intervals (as yearly or quarterly) for a certain or uncertain period

2.definition: the grant of or the right to receive an annuity [his will includedfor several old friends]

3.definition: a contract (as with an insurance company) under which one or more persons receive annuities in return for prior fixed payments made by themselves or another (as an employer)

annuities certain.definition: an annuity payable over a specified period even if the annuitant dies

annuities due.definition: an immediate annuity in which the payment of the benefits is made at the beginning of each payment interval rather than at the end

contingent annuity.definition: an annuity whose starting or ending date depends on the occurrence of an event (as the death of the annuitant) whose date is uncertain

con·ven·tion·al annuity.definition: an annuity under which the annuitant receives a specified minimum amount at each payment comparein this entry

deferred annuity.definition: an annuity in which payment of benefits is delayed until a particular time (as at retirement) comparein this entry

group annuity.definition: a pension plan paying annuity benefits at retirement for all eligible persons under a single master contract usually issued to an employer for the benefit of its employees

im·me·di·ate annuity.definition: an annuity purchased with a single premium in which payment of benefits begins within the first payment interval (as within a year) comparein this entry

joint-and-survivor annuity.definition: an annuity payable as long as any of the two or more annuitants remains alive called alsocomparein this entry

joint life annuity.definition: an annuity payable only until the death of any of the annuitants called alsocomparein this entry

life annuity.definition: an annuity payable during the annuitant's lifetime and terminating at death called also

life income-pe·ri·od cer·tain annuity.definition: an annuity that guarantees a minimum number of payments even if the annuitant dies before the minimum amount is paid or a minimum number of payments plus income for life if the annuitant is still alive after the minimum amount is paid

refund annuity.definition: an annuity in which payments to the annuitant or to the annuitant's estate or to a beneficiary are guaranteed to equal at least the amount of the premium paid for the annuity

var·i·able annuity.definition: [ver-ē-ə-bəl-]an annuity that is backed primarily by a fund of common stocks and whose payments go up or down depending on how well the stocks perform comparein this entryat
